channel.title: Trouble With New Website
channel.description:
Okay I am making a new website. I finished my login and registration and I built and tested it on my wamp server on my computer. It worked fine and I was very happy with it but when I uploaded it to my webhost and tried to login this is the error I got:
Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php:19) in /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php on line 63 Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php:19) in /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php on line 64 Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php:19) in /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php on line 65
Jorsa thought maybe that they had different php version. I'm not quite sure I was just wondering if use knew how to fix this. I will post my login script. If you needed any other scripts just post so. Here is the login script: Edit: Fixed no need for any more help.

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

thankyou zerofreeze I will use that instead…

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

You could also use a meta tag to redirect, i.e.

echo '<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0;url=lolol.php" /> ';

instead of using the header function.

Edit: forgot to close the meta tag

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

sorry I fixed it, I’m a retard I put the php after the tag. But when I put it as the first thing in my document. Everything works fine. This topic is irrelevant now. I fixed the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @b0x3r b0x3r
item.description:
@b0x3r wrote:

yeh if you have the session_start() function AFTER your doctype, that very error will come out…if your session.php only holds session variables, functions, and the starter function you might want to think about putthing that include above your doctype. see if that works?

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“imjohn10, post:4, topic:210561”]it is probably a problem with the header(“Location: index.php”);[/quote]It could be. Also, if you use start_session() or session_start, whatever the hell it is, in sessions.php, that’ll fail.

And you’ve already started writing to the page, making any header changes invalid.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

it is probably a problem with the header(“Location: index.php”);

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

“The “headers already sent” error is usually caused by having white space before or after the opening and closing PHP tags (<?php . . . ?>).”

Try that?

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With New Website

item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay I am making a new website. I finished my login and registration and I built and tested it on my wamp server on my computer.
It worked fine and I was very happy with it but when I uploaded it to my webhost and tried to login this is the error I got:

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php:19) in /home/forseen/public_html/orathan/login.php on line 63
